title: Electric ‘Ripples’ in the Resting Brain Tag Memories for Storage
excerpt: New experiments reveal how the brain chooses which memories to save and add credence to advice about the importance of rest.

title: The Mystery of S., the Man with an Impossible Memory
excerpt: A famous case study helped spark a myth about a man who could not forget. But the truth is more complicated.

title: Memories are made by breaking DNA — and fixing it
excerpt: Nature - Nerve cells form long-term memories with the help of an inflammatory response, study in mice finds.

title: What is it like to remember all the faces you’ve ever seen?
excerpt: They’ve been studied by researchers and recruited by police forces, but what’s it actually like to be a super-recogniser?

title: The Usefulness of a Memory Guides Where the Brain Saves It | Quanta Magazine
excerpt: New research finds that the memories useful for future generalizations are held in the brain separately from those recording unusual events.

title: What Causes Déjà Vu?
excerpt: Does this all feel a little familiar? Called déjà vu, that sensation may be your brain correcting its own errors

title: How the Brain Distinguishes Memories From Perceptions
excerpt: The neural representations of a perceived image and the memory of it are almost the same. New work shows how and why they are different.

title: Why We Remember Music and Forget Everything Else
excerpt: Psychologists say it's no surprise that we have such a strong memory for music and can easily recall lyrics and melodies, even if we haven’t heard them in years.

title: Everything We See Is a Mash-up of the Brain’s Last 15 Seconds of Visual Information
excerpt: The brain is basically a time machine that ensures what we see is stable and continuous.
